quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: View and Following
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, annan, drama. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What country conducted nuclear tests in 2006 and 2009, triggering widespread international condemnation?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: North Korea

questions.question: What invasion did Kofi Annan, the Secretary General of the UN, refer to when saying, I have indicated it was not in conformity with the UN Charter. From our point of view, from the Charter point of view, it was illegal.?

options.text: the U.S. Special Forces Attack on al-Qaida in Somalia

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the 2003 Invasion of Iraq

questions.question: During WWII Errol Flynn tried to enlist in the US armed forces.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who did Barak Obama defeat in the 2008 general election to become the first African American President?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: John McCain

questions.question: Who succeeded Fidel Castro when he resigned from office in February 2008?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: his brother Raul Castro

questions.question: Where was Errol Flynn born?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hobart, Tasmania

questions.question: Which of the following is not among the founders of Facebook, the leading social networking site of the 2000s?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Sean Parker

questions.question: Who do the following words belong to: We will rebuild. Were going to come out of this stronger than before, politically stronger, economically stronger. The skyline will be made whole again?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rudy Giuliani

questions.question: What war was launched in 2001 as Operation Enduring Freedom?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the War in Afghanistan

questions.question: At the time of its release in 2009, this movie, directed by James Cameron, became the highest-grossing movie of all time.

options.text: The Lord of the Rings: The Return of the King

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Avatar

questions.question: Name the producer of “The Rookies” and “Charlies Angels”.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aaron Spelling

questions.question: This film producer, director, screenwriter and voice actor, born in Chicago, Illinois, founded one of the largest entertainment companies in the world.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Walt Disney

questions.question: Which of the following was declassified as a planet in 2006 by the International Astronomical Union?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Pluto

questions.question: He directed, produced and co-wrote the drama movie Eyes Wide Shut.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Stanley Kubrick

questions.question: In 2001, this engineer and multimillionaire became the first fee-paying space tourist when he visited the International Space Station (ISS) for seven days.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Denis Tito

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Movies and Spanish American War
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, independence, land. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What politician received much publicity during the Spanish-American War that later contributed to his becoming President of the United States?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Theodore Roosevelt

questions.question: Which of these movies was written and directed by George Lucas?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Star Wars

questions.question: One of the causes of the Spanish-American War was Spanish mistreatment of natives in this Spanish colony.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cuba

questions.question: By 1897–98 many Americans were influenced in favor of war with Spain because of stories in some US newspapers about atrocities and misdeeds of the Spanish, which were usually exaggerated or made up. Such newspapers were know at the time as which of the following?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: yellow press

questions.question: The movies Forrest Gump, The Polar Express and Bewulf were directed by Robert Zemeckis.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: When Emilio Aguinaldo realized that the US did not intend to give full independence to his country after the Spanish-American War, he led a revolt against the US in what place?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Philippines

questions.question: Which of these movies was directed by Martin Scorsese?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: About how long was the Spanish-American War and in what year did it break out?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Three months; 1898

questions.question: Which of these movies directed by Francis Ford Coppola won an Academy Award for Best Picture?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Godfather

questions.question: Which action film, primarily set on Alcatraz Island, is dedicated to producer Don Simpson who died five months before its release?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Rock (1996)

questions.question: Steven Spielberg directed the movie Close Encounters of The Third Kind.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Where did most of the land fighting against the Spanish take place during the Spanish-American War?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Cuba

questions.question: At the beginning of the Spanish-American War a modern American fleet quickly and decisively defeated a somewhat antiquated Spanish fleet. Near what city was this early American victory?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Manila

questions.question: One cause of the Spanish American War was the explosion of an American battleship in Cuban waters. The sensationalist newspapers and many Americans blamed the sinking of this battleship on the Spanish (although later evidence seems to support the innocence of the Spanish). What was the name of the battleship?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maine

questions.question: What Canadian director and producer created the comedy movie Ghostbusters?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Ivan Reitman

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Marlene Dietrich and Movie
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, marry, sculpture. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Morocco (1930) was Marlene Dietrichs first American film.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Who did Marlene Dietrich marry in 1924?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rudolf Sieber

questions.question: As a result of the treaty ending the Spanish-American War, the US received all of the following territories EXCEPT this one.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hawaii

questions.question: What movie, set in post-World War I Berlin, featured Marlene Dietrich in her last screen appearance?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Just a Gigolo

questions.question: What Marlene Dietrich movie is set in 1931, during a civil war?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Shanghai Express

questions.question: The famous Statue of David by Michelangelo was created at the beginning of 16 century.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The Thinker is a stone statue created by Auguste Rodin.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: The following words were spoken by Marlene Dietrich:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What does the famous sculpture Pieta by Michelangelo represent?

options.text: Virgin Mary holding the body of her son Jesus Christ after his death
A girl holding the bowls as a weighing of good and evil
A lady holding a sword in a one hand and scales in the other

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Virgin Mary holding the body of her son Jesus Christ after his death

questions.question: In 1999, Marlene Dietrich was named the ninth greatest female star of all time by the American Film institute.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following films does not star Marlene Dietrich?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Monkey Business

questions.question: How old was Marlene Dietrich when she died?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: 90

questions.question: What is the real name of German actress and singer Marlene Dietrich?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Maria Magdalene Dietrich

questions.question: What movie brought world fame to Marlene Dietrich and introduced her signature song Falling in Love Again (Cant Help It)?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Blue Angel

questions.question: What is the other name of the Venus de Milo statue?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Aphrodite

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Petra and City
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, profession, bird. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Greek God Hermes bust was discovered at Olympia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Petra is a historical and archaeological city located in the Maan Governorate in Jordan.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which of the following is sight of interest at the historical city of Petra?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: All of these

questions.question: Under what rule did the historical city of Petra decline quickly as a result of which many of the tombs was damaged by thieves and many treasures were stolen?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Roman rule

questions.question: The Siq is the principal route into the city of Petra and its walls are lined with channels to carry drinking water to the city.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The city of Petra was founded by the nomadic tribe of the Nabataean Arabs around the 6th century BC.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: Which explorer introduced the ruins of the city of Petra to the Western world?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Johann Ludwig Burckhardt

questions.question: The statue Discus Thrower was created during the Classical Period (2th to 3th century BC).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What was the profession of the creator of the statue Bird Girl?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Teacher

questions.question: In which of the following movies does the ancient city of Petra not appear?

options.text: Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade
Sinbad and the Eye of the Tiger

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Golden eye

questions.question: Because of the color of the rocks in which it is carved in, the ancient city of Petra is known also known as which of these?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Rose-Red City

questions.question: 13th-century Italians Francesca da Rimini and Paolo Malatestas romance was the inspiration of the famous statue by Auguste Rodin – the Kiss.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The name of which popular monument in Petra means “The Castle of Pharaohs Daughter”?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Qasr al-Bint Firaun

questions.question: Since what time does the statue of Lady Justice date?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Antiquity

questions.question: The Caesar Augustus Bust was made from Carrara Marble with bronze plated armor.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Country and Petra
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, john, divine. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: English Anglican divine John William Burgons poem Petra, dedicated to the ancient historical city of Petra, was awarded the Newdigate Prize in 1945:
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: Printer steganography is a type of steganography where tiny yellow dots are added to each page.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In what country was the Bilderberg conference first held?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Netherlands

questions.question: What conspiracy theory involves a secret coalition whose aim is world domination?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Judeo-Masonic conspiracy theory

questions.question: Retired Marine Corps Major General Smedley Butler claimed that wealthy businessmen were plotting to overthrow this US President.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Franklin Delano Roosevelt

questions.question: In April, 2010 the President of this European country was killed in an airplane crash in western Russia.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Poland

questions.question: Which of these is the name of a secret society founded in the 18th century in Bavaria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Illuminati

questions.question: In which novel does a fictional totalitarian government use brainwashing-style techniques to erase nonconformist thought?

options.text: One Flew Over the Cuckoos Nest

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nineteen Eighty-Four

questions.question: What event is the film Loose Change based on?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the September 11, 2001 attacks

questions.question: What country won the most gold medals at the 2010 Winter Olympics, held in Vancouver, Canada?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Canada

questions.question: What does the abbreviation ZOG stand for?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Zionist Occupation Government

questions.question: The 2010 eruption of the Eyjafjallajökull volcano, located in this country, caused extensive air travel disruption.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Iceland

questions.question: The chemtrail conspiracy theory holds that some trails left by planes are actually chemical or biological agents deliberately sprayed at high altitudes.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: The first Ku Klux Klan was founded by veterans of the Confederate army.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: In January, 2010 a 7.0-magnitude earthquake devastated the capital of this country and caused the death of 230,000 people.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Haiti

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Cary Grant and Gary Cooper
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, picasso, grants. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: Cary Grant voiced his political views publicly.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: In what movie did Cary Grant co-star with Jimmy Stewart and Katharine Hepburn?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Philadelphia Story

questions.question: Gary Cooper starred in 16 silent films from 1926-1929.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: This sports official, who served as the seventh President of the International Olympic Committee, died in April 2010.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Juan Antonio Samaranch

questions.question: In July, 2010, the international non-profit organisation, known as WikiLeaks, released over 90,000 internal reports about the United States-led involvement in this war.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: War in Afghanistan

questions.question: What do the  initials I.M.F. stand for according to the Mission: Impossible series?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Impossible Mission Force

questions.question: What pandemic was officially declared over in August 2010?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: the H1N1 influenza pandemic

questions.question: Two of the actors from the Mission: Impossible series were in real life married to each other.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: True

questions.question: What was Cary Grants birth name?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Archibald Alexander Leach

questions.question: What country won the 2010 FIFA World Cup, held in South Africa?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Spain

questions.question: Cary Grant starred in this comedy movie featuring a pink submarine.

options.text: I Was a Male War Bride

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Operation Petticoat

questions.question: What painting by Pablo Picasso sold for US$106.5 million in 2010, setting a new world record for the most expensive work of art sold at auction?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Nude, Green Leaves and Bust

questions.question: Peter Graves played the part of Jim Phelps, the head of the IM force, from the beginning to the end of the Mission: Impossible series (1966 to 1973).
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: False

questions.question: What do Richard F. Heck, Mario Vargas Llosa, Liu Xiaobo and Robert G. Edwards have in common?

options.text: They were all awarded a Nobel Prize in 2010.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They were all awarded a Nobel Prize in 2010.

questions.question: Which state capital did Gary Cooper grow up in?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Helena, Montana
